DOC.brief_summary: A 48-week study to investigate the safety and effectiveness of a new compact formulation of two already FDA-approved anti-HIV drugs in subjects who have already been receiving treatment for their HIV infection.
DOC.brief_title: New Tablet Containing Two FDA Approved Anti-HIV Drugs For Antiretroviral Therapy Experienced HIV-1 Infected Subjects
DOC.detailed_description: A phase III, randomized, open-label, parallel, multicenter study to evaluate treatment with fixed-dose combination of abacavir/lamivudine (600mg/300mg) once-daily versus abacavir (300mg) twice-daily and lamivudine (300mg) once-daily in combination with tenofovir once-daily and a new PI or NNRTI for 48 weeks in ART-experienced HIV-1 infected patients.
DOC.criteria: Antiretroviral therapy (ART) experienced and currently receiving a stable regimen containing 3 nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs), or 2 NRTIs plus a protease inhibitor (PI) or nonnucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NNRTI) for at least 3 months (there should be no significant ART modifications for at least 3 months and no ART change anticipated between Screening and initiation of the study therapy). Patients must be naive to tenofovir. HIV1 RNA level > 1000 copies/ml on at least one occasion within 21 days of study entry. A CD4 cell count > 50 cells/mm3. Specified viral genotypes. Pregnant or breastfeeding women. Has an active diagnosis of AIDS. Additional qualifying criteria to be determined by the physician.
